abstract: Federal appeals court temporarily blocks two provisions of Alabama's far-reaching immigration enforcement law, but leaves much of the legislation intact as the state and the United States Justice Department continue to fight over law in court; appeal halts requirement that schools determine immigration status of students during enrollment and provision making it state crime for illegal immigrants to not carry registration documents.
snippet: An appeals court blocked provisions requiring illegal immigrants to carry registration documents and schools to learn the immigration status of enrollees and their parents.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court blocked provisions requiring illegal immigrants to carry registration documents and schools to learn the immigration status of enrollees and their parents.

headline.main: Part of Alabama Immigrant Law Blocked
headline.print_headline: Part of Alabama Immigrant Law Blocked
headline.seo: 2 Alabama Immigration Law Provisions Are Blocked
